page.title: 18A farm child's day
page.content: During a typical week work never goes scarce. Most farm children have to do a share of the work. { Saturday is usually the busiest day {as there is no school. }They have to feed calves in the morning and evening. The calves are held in various outhouses on the farm. They also{require hay, meal, milk or water. {Their houses also have to be cleaned {and bedded with dry straw so they can {have a dry place to lie during the {night. The small calves get cow's {milk to drink but the older calves get {a powdered milk mixed with water as a {drink. Some animals are on land that is further away from the main farmyard, some of which may be rented from other farmers in the area.
